title: Here’s Your Round-Up of Fake News Around Ram Temple ‘Bhoomi Pujan’
subtitle: Misinformation around the construction of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya has seen a spike in the last one week. The Quint’s WebQoof team has debunked at least seven such fake news stories in just about seven days.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
However, Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan never pledged to take ‘jal samadhi’ on not being invited to the ceremony. It’s actually the National President of Muslim Karsevak Manch, Kunwar Azam Khan who made the statement.

In another instance, a fabricated quote attributed to Kapil Sibal resurfaced on the internet. According to the false quote, Sibal had claimed that “he will die by suicide if Ram Mandir is built.” We found that this quote originated from an unreliable WordPress blog and Sibal had never said any such thing.

Similarly, a viral screenshot of a tweet, supposedly by SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, also found its way through social media, but even that turned out to be fake.
